themes: Underfunding of small arts organizations and artists
Inefficient use of accessibility resources (ASL translation)
Mismatch between accessibility requirements and actual audience needs
Desire for funding to directly benefit artists
key_phrases: rework the Elevate and Thrive grants to focus on the arts and serve more people/organizations by spreading the funding out more
we are still very small and highly underfunded
ASL translator who is being asked to translate LOTS of shows lately
event doesn’t have any audience members in need of her services
money that is not well spent and could be going to the artists instead
Requiring organizations to accommodate populations that aren’t frequenting certain events is not helpful for anyone
It is not actually serving the deaf community or the presenting artists
barriers_identified: Small and established organizations are highly underfunded
Funding requirements for accessibility services not matched to actual audience needs
Resources diverted from artists to unnecessary services
solutions_proposed: Rework the Elevate and Thrive grants to spread funding more widely
Align accessibility requirements with actual audience needs to avoid unnecessary expenditures
